Summary A skilled writer and editor with nearly 15 years of experience in technical and research communications, particularly in the engineering, medical, academic and public policy disciplines. Successfully written, edited and managed hundreds of business and PR materials—both for print and web—including electronic and print newsletters, press releases, development and research reports, grant proposals, specifications, flyers, letters, brochures and invitations, along with other research and donor materials. Proven ability to manage projects successfully from start to finish, including conceiving story ideas, conducting interviews for articles, writing and editing work, and teaming with graphic and web designers to produce quality printed and electronic newsletters and reports. Experience Research Communications Specialist The University of Utah December 2007  –  May 2012  (4 years 6 months) Hired to originate this position. Served as sole writer and editor for the College’s public relations efforts. Started from the ground up to create PR materials for outreach to internal and external media, potential donors, students and faculty from other schools of engineering.  
Managed workflow for graphic and web designers. Wrote, edited and redesigned the College’s semi-annual newsletter, annual research report, monthly e-newsletter, media releases, web content and printed materials.  
Interviewed faculty about complex engineering research topics and reframed material into articles that could be understood by non-expert audiences. 
Generated hundreds of news items and articles for print and electronic media designed to increase awareness and enhance the reputation of the College’s research, activities and achievements. 
Created and managed a contact database of thousands of engineering professionals and faculty for public relations purposes. Helped to increase the College’s visibility, rankings and status among other engineering schools across the United States and internationally. Program Associate Stanford University, The Hoover Institution September 2003  –  November 2007  (4 years 3 months) Served as project manager for the director’s fundraising initiative. Wrote proposals and reports to individuals, foundations and organizations as part of a university campaign, resulting in more than $5 million in gifts annually. 
• Maintained foundation relations. Solicited donors through proposals and other written material. Wrote donor acknowledgment letters. 
• Served as contributing writer and editor to annual report. 
• Managed grants timetable to ensure that annual solicitations and reporting requirements met deadlines. 
• Responsible for overhauling the introductory process for potential donors to Hoover. Rewrote marketing materials to clarify Hoover’s mission message to potential donors. 
• Helped write and launch a new web feature that provides factual information to Hoover audiences. Assisted in design process. Communications Associate Stanford University, Office of Medical Development September 2001  –  August 2003  (2 years) Wrote and edited four quarterly medical research newsletters; interviewed faculty; contributed story, design and layout ideas. Served as contributing writer and editor to annual report. 
• Managed Stanford medical center’s heart development newsletter for financial donors. Researched story ideas; wrote and edited stories; worked with freelancers, graphic designer, printer, and mailhouse to produce and send materials to donors on schedule. 
• Managed all phases of development, production, and printing invitations and brochures for medical alumni reunions event materials. Edited materials to aid in readability, which resulted in fewer reunion registration errors. 
• Wrote solicitation proposals to potential donors; wrote and edited invitations for various medical events; composed acknowledgment letters to donors. 
• Participated on internal taskforce to determine the office’s compliance with new government regulations related to privacy standards for patient information. Disseminated information discussed in taskforce group to communications group. Managing Editor HCPro, Inc November 1999  –  February 2001  (1 year 4 months) Specializing in health care regulatory information 
Marblehead, MA	 
Managing Editor (promoted from Editorial Assistant) 
• Wrote and edited articles and developed layout for print and email newsletters. 
• Managed, wrote, and edited content for Web site. Coordinated marketing, sales and editorial departments to improve sales. 
• Found and solved problem of not being able to answer Web site users’ questions in timely manner by creating new e-mail newsletter with no overhead costs that generated revenue. 
• Researched grant opportunities for potential newsletters. 
• Covered conferences and seminars; developed contacts and interviewed sources for articles. Experience Social Impact Project Manager GitHub May 2015  – Present (4 months) San Francisco Bay Area GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over eight million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. Director of Strategy and Innovation Vaya Consulting 2014  –  2015  (1 year) Berkeley, CA Vaya Consulting’s mission is to help launch or improve the diversity efforts of companies and organizations, primarily in the US. Thoughtful, effective efforts to increase diversity among employees, boards, and investors is an imperative for Vaya’s clients who realize that these efforts can no long be walled off from central business strategy. Special Projects Associate Kapor Center for Social Impact 2013  –  2014  (1 year) Oakland, CA Founded by Mitch Kapor and Freada Kapor Klein, The Kapor Center sits at the intersection of technology and social justice. We relentlessly pursue creative strategies that will leverage information technology for positive social impact. We primarily work with underrepresented communities, focusing on closing academic, political, health, and economic gaps. Executive Producer Stanford Repertory Theater 2007  –  September 2010  (3 years) Stanford, CA Produced 11 productions (3 seasons) of professional repertory theatre. Directed media relations, patron management, publicity, and ticket sales. Supervised Assistant Producers, volunteers, and interns. Communications Associate Stanford University Haas Center for Public Service 2009  –  June 2010  (1 year) Stanford, CA Created written, oral, and visual projects for publication to highlight the work of Stanford University’s Haas Center for Public Service, which inspires and prepares students to create a more just and sustainable world through service, scholarship, and community partnerships. The Haas Center engages more than 1,000 students annually in global service across diverse pathways – direct service, engaged scholarship, activism, philanthropy, public policy, and social entrepreneurship. Director of Recruitment and Advocacy Specialist New Global Citizens 2007  –  2008  (1 year) San Francisco Bay Area New Global Citizens mobilizes young people in the United States to support grassroots efforts for human rights social change in the developing world through philanthropy, activism, and education.  
 
-Designed and executed national recruitment efforts 
-Created New Global Citizens’ advocacy program, directing the Advocacy Leadership Committee.  
-Chaperoned trip of 10 US high school students to Bangladesh to research grassroots environmental NGOs.

Summary I am a seasoned professional with over 15 years of experience in organizations dedicated to education, community development, and community engagement. I am a writer and former community advocate who took these skills into communications to tell compelling social change stories and help young people share their own stories. The most gratifying aspect of my work is coaching students on communicating their research projects and personal stories so they can powerfully engage with the broader public. I write and edit across multiple platforms, and advise students and faculty on communications strategy and media relations. I am proficient in Drupal and HTML, and have experience in website content management, database management, digital photo editing, and social justice grantmaking. 
 
Some topics I have covered include: girls' schooling in Turkey, culturally sensitive HIV education in India, the Preschool for All initiative, youth arts activism in the Bay Area, and Northern Cheyenne resistance to methane development in Montana. Writing areas of interest: K-12 and higher education, arts-based youth development, community health, and environmental justice.
